Incident Description: two cheetah cubs collected in the bush were confiscated. The man claimed that he can sell small cubs for about 150 USD each and if they survive and are bigger they yield about 500 USD each. One died; the other was handed it over to GAA for care. The case had been under investigation since mid of October.
Action Taken: A SLD field team staff noticed the cheetahs and decided that they should be left there under the condition that the ‘collector’ desist from trying to sell them any longer. The ‘collector’ agreed on this, and was provided with a mobile phone in order to monitor the cubs. However, due to the conditions under which the cubs were kept, the issue became an animal welfare issue  In mid-November one of the cubs died apparently in an accident (no clear confirmation, it’s also possible that it was sold) and the second cub's condition was quickly deteriorating. The Regional Environment Co-ordinator confiscated the cheetah and handed it over to SLD field team.
Outcome: One cub died in the early second half of November. Second cub under SLD field team's care died on 2 of December.

There is now some indication that this is the same case. The latest details are that 9 cheetah cubs have crossed the border in the night from 09.02.13 to 10.02.13 from Ethiopia to Somaliland. They have been part of a consignment of 15 cubs of which the smugglers have selected the 9 bigger cubs. The 6 remaining cubs remain in Ethiopia. And this is what concerns these guys most, that they lose money.
Outcome: 10-Feb-13: Cubs have been moved probably to the wider area well within Ethiopia but have currently no detailed information about their whereabouts. The arrested persons have been again all released after some clan pressure on the police in Harirad.
